name: IBM Cloud Satellite - Sales Enablement Level 3 Demonstration Guide
description:
This repository contains the IBM Cloud Satellite - Sales Enablement Level 3 Demonstration Guide content that IBM sellers and IBM Business Partners can use to learn how to demonstrate IBM Cloud Satellite. To access the content of this repository using MKDOC and pages, go here: https://ibm.github.io/SalesEnablement-Satellite-L3/ 

Note: the live environment that can be leveraged with this script is only available to IBM sellers and IBM Business Partners.

name: perlport
description: Port of perl to z/OS
contribution_justification: https://github.com/ZOSOpenTools/perlport/blob/main/README.md
license_location_justification: https://github.com/ZOSOpenTools/perlport/blob/main/LICENSE
floss_license_justification: https://github.com/ZOSOpenTools/perlport/blob/main/LICENSE The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: Documentation is the Perl general documentation. Specifics for z/OS have already been upstreamed to Perl 5 .
documentation_interface_justification: The 'perl port' repo provides a 'wrapper' that shows how to build Perl on z/OS. As such, the tools themselves reference Perl 5 Open Source and provides z/OS specifics such as build tools and the like.
repo_public_justification: github https://github.com/ZOSOpenTools/perlport
repo_track_justification: github https://github.com/ZOSOpenTools/perlport
repo_interim_justification: github tags, branches, commits, PRs used as per standard git source dev
repo_distributed_justification: github with git releases used
version_unique_justification: branches and releases used under github
release_notes_justification: We have not had our first official release yet. When we do, we will provide this information
release_notes_vulns_justification: When we have our release, we will have a reference to the common information in the general Perl 5 release information
report_archive_justification: At this point, we have not archived anything. Everything is available. If we were to archive, we would ensure it met this requirement using github archiving: https://docs.github.com/en/repositories/archiving-a-github-repository/archiving-repositories
vulnerability_report_process_justificati: The general Perl 5 security policy process is here: https://perldoc.perl.org/perlsecpolicy
vulnerability_report_private_justificati: vulnerability reports are sent directly to Perl5 repo, not to our repo
vulnerability_report_response_justificat: From their doc previously referenced: New vulnerability reports will receive an initial reply within 72 hours from the time they arrive at the security team's mailing list
build_justification: We use Jenkins which drives a build when code is checked in.
test_justification: We run the 'make tests' which is all open source. Our documentation explains how to run these tests.
test_invocation_justification: testing is done using standard Unix practices, e.g. 'make tests'
test_most_justification: We are adding support for the Perl Smoke Test as we improve our code quality and are able to add this support.
test_policy_justification: We have a policy that changes (typically bug fixes) require a separate branch that is then reviewed by another member through a Pull Request and that it passes at least as many tests as before the bug fix (equal or better quality)
tests_are_added_justification: process is to test any change before creating a pull request. Jenkins will also perform this test and fail the build if issues uncovered.
tests_documented_added_justification: Our process is that new tests should be written for code previously untested or new code writted.
warnings_justification: code is built with warnings enabled.
warnings_fixed_justification: Code must 'compile clean' as part of the process.
warnings_strict_justification: We use specific pragmas to turn off individual warnings, but only where required due to the common code.
know_secure_design_justification: Mike Fulton knows how to design secure software, and is a primary developer.
know_common_errors_justification: Mike Fulton knows common kinds of errors leading to vulnerabilities and is a primary developer.
crypto_published_justification: The code in this repository does not use any cryptographic protocols.
crypto_floss_justification: no function in the software depending on cryptopgraphy.
static_analysis_justification: We have manually run shellcheck and will incorporate shellcheck into our build process to eliminate the manual process. https://github.com/ZOSOpenTools/perlport/issues/33
static_analysis_fixed_justification: manual run with follow-up bug fixing for now. Near future, add this to the pipeline.
dynamic_analysis_justification: The primary shell script performs a build. The build takes 20 minutes. Iterating over a variety of possible inputs would be computationally very expensive. I would be open to ideas to improve on this.
dynamic_analysis_enable_assertions_justi: This is a good idea. Opened this as an issue: https://github.com/ZOSOpenTools/perlport/issues/34
dynamic_analysis_fixed_justification: We are not doing dynamic analysis at this time.
general_comments: This 'port' repository is part of a set of repositories all under z/OS Open Tools: https://github.com/ZOSOpenTools and is part of a larger effort to ensure that z/OS is 'just another' operating system customers can get pre-built or source-level software for.
discussion_justification: Uses github issues: https://github.com/ZOSOpenTools/perlport/issues
hardened_site_justification: // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".
maintained_justification: This link: https://github.com/ZOSOpenTools/perlport/graphs/commit-activity shows commits from multiple authors

floss_license_osi_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: Some documentation basics file contents found.
documentation_interface_justification:
https://aihwkit.readthedocs.io/

Thorough documentation of the library is produced via sphinx, based on the docstrings in the .py files
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_interim_justification: Development is done against the master branch (with the https://github.com/IBM/aihwkit/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md updated accordingly), and new features are added by pull request (requiring review). Users can clone the repository and explore the git history to access features that will be included in next release.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
version_tags_justification:
Releases are automated - a git tag in the repository triggers a release
https://github.com/IBM/aihwkit/releases
https://pypi.org/project/aihwkit/
release_notes_justification: Non-trivial release notes file in repository: <https://github.com/IBM/aihwkit/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md>.
release_notes_vulns_justification: The changelog https://github.com/IBM/aihwkit/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md is based on https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/, where each change is categorized. One of these categories is "Security" - while we did not have them in the past, it would be the place for such notifications
report_tracker_justification: Project uses standard github conventions, where users can submit reports to https://github.com/IBM/aihwkit/issues
report_process_justification: Project uses standard github conventions, where users can submit reports to https://github.com/IBM/aihwkit/issues
vulnerability_report_process_justificati: Vulnerabilities can be reported as regular issues at https://github.com/IBM/aihwkit/issues, there is no specific process for reporting vulnerabilities
vulnerability_report_private_justificati: There is no specific process for reporting vulnerabilities - the README lists an email address as a generic contact means.
build_justification:
Non-trivial build file in repository: <https://github.com/IBM/aihwkit/blob/master/CMakeLists.txt>.
https://github.com/IBM/aihwkit/blob/master/setup.py

The package can be built using standard Python build system (with skbuild and cmake)
build_common_tools_justification:
Non-trivial build file in repository: <https://github.com/IBM/aihwkit/blob/master/CMakeLists.txt>.

Standard tools are used (setuptools, skbuild, cmake).
build_floss_tools_justification: The library and its dependencies are open source.
test_justification: The full test suite is available at https://github.com/IBM/aihwkit/tree/master/tests, and it is run via CI on each pull request and commit. Instructions for development are at https://github.com/IBM/aihwkit/blob/master/docs/source/development_conventions.rst and https://github.com/IBM/aihwkit/blob/master/docs/source/developer_install.rst
test_invocation_justification: The test suite can be invoked by Python stdlib unittest module or other common test runners (pytest)
test_most_justification: The test suite https://github.com/IBM/aihwkit/tree/master/tests aims to be extensive, and pull requests are required to include tests as part of the review.
test_policy_justification: Pull requests are required to include tests - enforced by the reviewers, and hinted at in the contribution guidelines https://github.com/IBM/aihwkit/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md
tests_are_added_justification: The pull request history https://github.com/IBM/aihwkit/pulls contains evidence that tests are required by the reviewers for new/changes in functionality.
tests_documented_added_justification: The contribution guidelines https://github.com/IBM/aihwkit/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md currently hint at tests, but don't explicitly mention them.
warnings_justification:
https://aihwkit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/development_conventions.html#code-conventions

CI (travis) has a mandatory "lint and style" stage check, using Python linters (pylint, pycodestyle, mypy) and C++ (clang-format) in order to verify code quality before the pull request can be merged.
warnings_fixed_justification: CI (travis) has a mandatory "lint and style" stage check - PRs must address and fix warnings issue by the tools before the pull request can be merged.
warnings_strict_justification: The project has custom configurations for the linting tools that reflect an emphasis on QA.
know_secure_design_justification: The project members include experience software developers.
know_common_errors_justification: The project members include experience software developers.
delivery_mitm_justification: Releases are published and delivered via standard PyPI https://pypi.org/project/aihwkit/, which adheres to ssh and best practices
delivery_unsigned_justification: Releases are published and delivered via standard PyPI https://pypi.org/project/aihwkit/, which adheres to ssh and best practices
static_analysis_justification: Pylint and mypy are applied in CI in each PR and commit, which contain a certain degree of code analysis.
static_analysis_common_vulnerabilities_j: Pylint, while not a security tool, includes checks for common issues.
static_analysis_often_justification: Pylint and mypy are applied in CI in each PR and commit, which contain a certain degree of code analysis.
dynamic_analysis_justification: No dynamic analysis tool is applied currently
dynamic_analysis_unsafe_justification: No dynamic analysis tool is applied currently
dynamic_analysis_enable_assertions_justi: No dynamic analysis tool is applied currently
test_continuous_integration_justificatio: CI (Travis) is configured to run the test suite under different platforms and versions in each PR and commit.
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
no_leaked_credentials_justification: No credentials are stored in the repository.
english_justification: English is the default language in the repo and the documentation.
